page.title: 09NETHER ALDERLEY MILL
page.content: Nether Alderley Mill is under National Trust care.It was built in 1290.The mill machinery was replaced in the 1800s.The stream that drove the mill was an exceptionally small one.The Elizabethen millwrights overcame this problem by building a large dam across the valley,the back of the mill making part of the wall.Between 1967 and 1970 Dr Boucher rebuilt the mill.The mill attracts 1000 people every year.The cogs are made from apple wood and the spine wheel is made from beech.There is one custodian looking after it. The reservoir was filled day and night by the stream. in the morning the dam would be full for a period of eight hours.There are two hundred tons of stone on the roof.The beams are the original ones.
